messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Onto Kittens now
messages.msgSnippet: ... The local animal shelter holds a candlelight ceremony every year to reflect on all the animals they ve had to kill the previous year.  It s a way to honor
messages.messageBody:
Jessi wrote:
>
> I see too many unwanted animals everyday. I have over 20 dogs and about 10
> cats right now and 2 kittens that have no place to call home so I am sorry
> if my tone is at all harsh in this post. When you have to see how many are
> put to sleep in the other shelters, daily no less, it makes your heart
> ache. I see the eyes filled with love and purring away as I go to the kill
> shelters to pick up one of our dogs that got left there and know that there
> is nothing I can do to get them out of there.
>

The local animal shelter holds a candlelight ceremony every year to
reflect on all the animals they've had to kill the previous year. It's
a way to honor them (the animals) and to help the workers heal.

--

Cindy Ferguson
crma@...
